# Preface{-}

```{r dino, echo=FALSE, fig.height=3, fig.width=4, message=FALSE, error=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(datasauRus)
data("datasaurus_dozen")
dino_data <- datasaurus_dozen %>%
  dplyr::filter(dataset=="dino")
ggplot(dino_data) + geom_point(aes(x,y)) + theme_bw() + xlab("") + ylab("") + theme(axis.text=element_blank()) + ggtitle("DatasauRus Rex")
```

# Preliminary Review{-}

This text assumes the reader has completed an introductory statistics course. For those needing a refresher, two links are provided below.

https://bookdown.org/chesterismay/rbasics/

http://moderndive.com/index.html

The text utilizes the R computing system. We will be using the following add-on packages.

* `tidyverse`
* `knitr`
* `GGally`
* `ggfortify`
* `gridExtra`
* `emmeans`
* `lindia`
* `car`
* `leaps`

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(emmeans)
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)
library(tidyverse)
library(GGally)
library(ggfortify)
library(gridExtra)
library(lindia)
library(car)
library(leaps)
options(digits=6)
```
